citations.narrative:
On February 1, 2023, the male capuchin Bambam was attacked by a dog and died. The licensee and his family were
playing with the capuchin in the backyard, outside of his primary enclosure, on a kid’s climbing structure. Per a facility
representative, one of the dogs present, reacting to the cries/squeals of one of the children, attacked the capuchin and
killed him instantly. Improper handling of this capuchin outside of his primary enclosure and in the presence of dogs
resulted in his death. Handling of all animals shall be done as expeditiously and carefully as possible in a manner that
does not cause trauma, physical harm, or unnecessary discomfort. Correct by 07/05/2024.

At the time of inspection, 3 zebu were housed in a sizeable pasture littered with a large amount of heavy machinery and
broken mechanical objects. The gate to this pasture was also open allowing access to the road. These housing conditions
could result in animal injury or escape. The outdoor housing facilities must be maintained in good repair to protect the
animals from injury and to contain them securely. Correct by 07/05/2024.

The only water receptacle for 1 zebra and 4 zebu was in need of cleaning. The water through had a thick layer of slimy
brown fuzzy material coating the interior walls and the bottom. There was a moderate amount of fuzzy brown material
floating on the surface of the water. Unclean and unsanitary drinking water can cause illness and discomfort to these
animals. All water receptacles must be kept clean and sanitary. To be corrected by 07/05/2024.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.
